call_title: Ergo PoW Blockchain - Weekly Update & AMA - January 23rd 2025 PART 2

decisions.decision: Rework the DAO and make PID based DAO with temporary DAOs or Ergodevs 2025
decisions.speaker: kushti
decisions.context: To have very concrete specific goals for 2025 and specific funding goals
decisions.quote: What I'm proposing is to have just temporary DAOs or Ergodevs 2025, to have very concrete specific goals for 2025 and then also pretty specific funding goals to be met to reach the goals

decisions.decision: Fire up the temporary organization totally at the end of 2025 and start from scratch next year
decisions.speaker: kushti
decisions.context: Part of the temporary DAO structure
decisions.quote: The idea is to have just a temporary organization and then fire it up totally at the end of 2025 and start from scratch next year

commitments.commitment: Adding APIs for applications for sub-blocks
commitments.quote: some early version may be available in just a few days

commitments.commitment: Application developers will have possibility to play with single nodes, local miner-based testing environments
commitments.quote: application developers at least will have a possibility starting from, yeah, very soon, TM, to play with single nodes, local miner-based testing environments

commitments.commitment: Will message Dan after the call about coordination
commitments.quote: I will message you after, but maybe tomorrow because it's late, right? On your side, sir

open_questions.question: Tokenomics questions for the PID based DAO rework
open_questions.context: kushti tried to rework the DAO yesterday but got into tokenomics questions

open_questions.question: How to manage the treasury with a temporary DAO
open_questions.context: Discussion about transferring treasury to new DAO

open_questions.question: How off-chain exchange of ChainCash notes would work
open_questions.context: qx() still can't wrap his head around the off-chain exchange mechanism

key_facts.fact: Sub-blocks development has good progress with local miner-based DevNet generating input blocks correctly
key_facts.speaker: kushti

key_facts.fact: 6.0 audit is ongoing with one small issue left unfixed
key_facts.speaker: kushti

key_facts.fact: More than 27,000 ERG in bounties are available for developers
key_facts.speaker: kushti

key_facts.fact: Cornell BRICK was introduced to 300-400 students in architecture classes
key_facts.speaker: qx()

key_facts.fact: Tipperbot and front/back end for plot submission system accepting Ergo payments for BRICK is set up and tested
key_facts.speaker: qx()
